subject: RE: [junit] How to create data-driven tests?
msgSnippet: I d suggest looking at dbunit (see the extensions section on the junit site) and using multiple dbunit DataSets.  You could for example have some method that
messageBody:
I'd suggest looking at dbunit (see the extensions section on the junit site)
and using multiple dbunit DataSets. You could for example have some method
that contains most of the testing logic and it takes as a parameter a
dataset to use. That test method reads the dataset and inserts the test
data into the database, performs the appropriate tests, and then cleans out
the database. Each of your actual testcase methods could then call this
method, each one specifying a different dbunit dataset to use. With dbunit
you can have your different datasets defined in different xml files.

-Christian
-----Original Message-----
From: vibha_malhotra16_2 [mailto:vibha_malhotra16_2@...]
Sent: Monday, May 13, 2002 4:06 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] How to create data-driven tests?


Hi Guys,

Are there any methods in JUnit using which one testcase can be
executed repeatedly with different data sets as inputs? These
datasets and the expected results are to be imported from and Access
Database.

Thanks in advance,

Vibha
